subanswer.text: Using herons formula...since \(abc\)are constants\\begin{aligned}&bc=cg=eg={\sqrt{2}/2}, bd={1}\\&=bcd={\sqrt{2}}\quad &\text{(using pythogoras)} \\&\sin(\theta)={{bd}\over{ab}}=1/\sqrt{2}; &r_1={\sqrt{2}},\cos(\theta)=\sqrt{2}/2\\end{aligned}[...] Calculate geometry ...We now know r_1 =\sqrt{2}(area of \(\triangle ABC\))And similarly, calculate other quantities needed:\\[CEF &= \pi({1-\cos{\alpha})\over4}) = \dfrac{\pi}{\sqrt{2}}(\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{2}}) = \dfrac{\pi}{2}][\dots]\begin{aligned}&&AED &&AFC\\&af &=ad\qquad &=\sqrt{2},\;\sin(\beta)&=(af)/\sqrt{2} \\&fc &=ec\qquad &=\sqrt{2},\;\cos(\beta)&={{cf}\over{ac}}=\dfrac{\sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{2}}=1\\&fd &=df+de\qquad &=\sqrt{2}+\sqrt{2}=\sqrt{4}=2,\;\tan(\gamma)&=(fd)\over{fc}\\&=1,\quad [\therefore \Delta_{FD} ]\\\Rightarrow& fdg+afc = efg+ace+bfd\qquad [Area\,of\,Polygon:= Sum\,\text{of}\,All\,the\,Individual\,Triangle \, Areas].\end{aligned}$$Finally summing everything above:[![Alt Text](https://latex.codecogs.com/png.image?%5Clarge%201%5Ctimes%20%5Co%3CV%3DPoints-%5CLarge%20PVQ%2CSRT&space;isometric%20projections%20with%20points%20at%20origin.))](https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.download?%5Clarge%201%5Ctimes%20%5Co%3AV%3DPoints-%5CLarge%20PVQ%2CSRT&space;isometric%20projections%20with%20points%2
